title: Peacock Looks to Beijing Winter Olympics for a Second Chance
sub_head: Comcast’s nascent streaming service will provide full access to live coverage after drawing criticism during Tokyo Games
body:
Audie Norman signed up for Comcast Corp.’s Peacock last summer after hearing that the streaming service made it possible to watch the Tokyo Olympics without a pay-TV subscription, which he hasn’t had in at least a decade.
When the 42-year-old Macon, Ga., resident and his wife, Julia, tried to watch the Olympics’ opening ceremony—Ms. Norman’s favorite event—he realized it wasn’t available on the service. Neither were most Olympic competitions, which were broadcast live exclusively on NBC and its sister cable channels, which like Peacock are owned by Comcast’s NBCUniversal unit.
